q1.q: Which of the following is an example of an object in motion with constant speed but changing velocity?
q1.o1: A car traveling in a straight line at a steady speed
q1.o2: A car moving in a circular path at a constant speed
q1.o3: A car slowing down as it approaches a traffic light
q1.o4: A car accelerating as it goes downhill

q2.q: What is the SI unit of electric current?

q3.o1: Which of the following best describes the conservation of energy principle?
q3.o2: Energy can be created but not destroyed
q3.o3: Energy can be destroyed but not created.
q3.o4: Energy is conserved in all physical processes.
q3.o5: Energy is only conserved in mechanical systems

q4.q: Which of the following materials has the highest coefficient of thermal expansion?

q5.q: Which of the following statements about Newton's laws of motion is correct?
q5.o1: Newton's first law describes the relationship between force, mass, and acceleration
q5.o2: Newton's second law states that an object at rest will remain at rest unless acted upon by an unbalanced force.
q5.o3: Newton's third law states that for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.
q5.o4: Newton's laws are only applicable to objects in outer space.
